sub_topic: The construction of the Heighway dragon curve.
message_1: What is the total length of the Heighway Dragon curve after the 8th iteration if the length of the initial segment is 1 unit? Note that each iteration repeats the same pattern twice and each segment is half the length of the previous iteration.
message_2:
The total length of the Heighway Dragon curve after the nth iteration can be calculated using the formula:

Length = Initial segment length * (2^n - 1) / (2^(n-1))

In this case, the initial segment length is 1 unit, and we want to find the length after the 8th iteration. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Length = 1 * (2^8 - 1) / (2^(8-1))
Length = 1 * (256 - 1) / (2^7)
Length = 1 * 255 / 128
Length = 255 / 128
Length = 1.9921875 units

So, the total length of the Heighway Dragon curve after the 8th iteration is approximately 1.9921875 units.
